military for the future.( AP| KENNETH LAMBERT) to a reporter's question about whether there actually was evidence of any link between Saddam Hussein and terrorists seeking weapons of mass destruction. The Defense secretary responded: Reports that say that something hasn't happened are always interesting to me because, as we know, there are known knowns; there are things we know we know. We also know there are known unknowns; that is to say we know there are some things we do not know. But there are also unknown unknowns- the ones we don't know we don't know. It is, of course, a logical fallacy to multiply categories beyond necessity, but it's one Donald Rumsfeld has rhetorically mastered to create a self-conscious reputation as a fearless questioner of received truths, one he's

Esther Dyson , a veteran Valley investor who has long known the Google founders and Mr. Eric Schmidt , said, It is unexpected but it makes a lot of sense. She added: "Larry and Sergey Brin have grown up. They want to run their own company." After the management change, Mr. Sergey Brin will concentrate on several new products, which he declined to

into China," the BBC quoted Eric Schmidt , as saying. Although Eric Schmidt said that he was happy with Google's decision to stop co-operating with China over censorship in March last year, he added: Over time I would hope, especially in my new role with more of an external focus, that I can try to get more of Google, appropriately and within our policies, into China. It was revealed earlier this month that fifty-five-year-old Eric Schmidt would make way as chief executive for Larry Page, 37, who co-founded Google with Sergey Brin .
